snippet: The video-sharing Web site has created a way to let schools limit students’ access to selected content, providing a portal for free educational materials.
abstract: YouTube is gaining popularity among educators as a trove of free educational materials after Google, site's parent company, introduced YouTube for Schools; new site allows schools to pluck only the videos they want and link only to other related educational videos.
lead_paragraph: The video-sharing Web site has created a way to let schools limit students’ access to selected content, providing a portal for free educational materials.

headline.seo: YouTube Finds a Way Off Schools’ Banned List
headline.main: YouTube Subtracts Racy and Raucous to Add a Teaching Tool
headline.print_headline: YouTube Subtracts Racy and Raucous to Add a Teaching Tool
